description: From Middle French inviolable, from Latin inviolābilis (“untouchable”), from violō (“violate”).

adjectives.description: inviolable (comparative more inviolable, superlative most inviolable)

entries.meaning: Not violable; not to be infringed.
examples: Antonyms: (incapable of being complied) incompliable, (capable of being violated) violable, (capable of being violated) breakable

entries.meaning: Not susceptible to violence, or of being profaned, corrupted, or dishonoured.
Incapable of being injured or invaded; indestructible.
